meanings.sent1: Her delusivenesses made it hard to trust her words.
meanings.sent2: The delusivenesses of the advertisement led many to buy the product.
meanings.sent3: The magician's delusivenesses made the audience gasp in amazement.
meanings.sent4: The delusivenesses of the mirage in the desert fooled the weary travelers.
meanings.sent5: The delusivenesses of the online quiz left many scratching their heads in confusion.

meanings.definition: The state of being deceptive or misleading.
meanings.sent1: The delusivenesses of the con artist were finally exposed.
meanings.sent2: Politicians often use delusivenesses to sway public opinion.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful delusivenesses kept the dog entertained for hours.
meanings.sent4: The delusivenesses of the fog obscured the view of the city skyline.
meanings.sent5: The delusivenesses of the maze confused the participants during the race.
